transbit.tbits.common
Class Timestamp

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Date
      transbit.tbits.common.Timestamp
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<java.util.Date>
public class Timestamp
extends java.util.Date
implements java.lang.Comparable<java.util.Date>, java.io.Serializable

This class is a subclass of java.util.Date with additional methods that are generally used during manipulation of date fields.

Version:
: $Id: $
Author:
: Vaibhav, : Vinod Gupta
See Also:

Timestamp

public Timestamp(java.lang.String aDateStr)
          throws java.text.ParseException
Constructor which sets the Timestamp to the given date String. The date should be specified in yyyyMMddHHmmss format.

Parameters:
aDateStr - the date string
Throws:
java.text.ParseException - if date string is not in the required format

aDateStr - the date string
aFormat - the date string format
Throws:
java.text.ParseException - if date string is not in the specified format

toDateMinold

public java.lang.String toDateMinold()

toGmtTimestamp

public Timestamp toGmtTimestamp()
Returns a GMT equivalent local time. Example : if Timestamp has 03/26/2003 16:30 IST function returns 03/36/2003 11:00 IST which is the GMT equivalent in local time.

toPreferredZone

public static java.util.Date toPreferredZone(Timestamp aGmtTime,
                                             java.lang.String aTimeZone)
This method takes the GMT Timestamp in Site's Zone and then returns the local date in preferred zone.

Parameters:
aGmtTime - Gmt Time in Site's Zone.
aTimeZone - Preferred Time Zone.
Returns:
local Date time inspecified zone.

getTimeZone

public static final java.util.TimeZone getTimeZone(java.lang.String timeZone)
Gets the TimeZone for the given ID. Returns null if not found.

Parameters:
timeZone - the ID for a TimeZone, either an abbreviation such as "EST", a full name such as "America/New_York", or a custom ID such as "GMT-5:00".
Returns:
the specified TimeZone, or null if the given ID cannot be understood.

getTimestamp

public static Timestamp getTimestamp(java.util.Date d)
Factory method to get Timestamp object from a given date object.

Parameters:
d - Date object from which the timestamp object should be created.

getTimestamp

public static Timestamp getTimestamp(Timestamp ts)

ts - Timestamp object from which the current one should be created.
